title: Failed to automatically apply fixes
body:
I tried running ```bash cargo clippy --fix ``` I expected to see this happen: Some fixes get applied, or not applied. Instead, this happened: Some fixes could not be applied, and rustc / cargo asked me to file an issue here:
cargo clippy --fix output

``` cargo clippy --fix Compiling probe-rs-target v0.16.0 (/Users/tiwalun/code/probe-rs/probe-rs-target) Checking xtask v0.16.0 (/Users/tiwalun/code/probe-rs/xtask) Compiling probe-rs v0.16.0 (/Users/tiwalun/code/probe-rs/probe-rs) warning: failed to automatically apply fixes suggested by rustc to crate `probe_rs` after fixes were automatically applied the compiler reported errors within these files: * probe-rs/src/probe/stlink/mod.rs This likely indicates a bug in either rustc or cargo itself, and we would appreciate a bug report! You're likely to see a number of compiler warnings after this message which cargo attempted to fix but failed. If you could open an issue at https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues quoting the full output of this command we'd be very appreciative! Note that you may be able to make some more progress in the near-term fixing code with the `--broken-code` flag The following errors were reported: error[E0425]: cannot find value `value` in this scope --> probe-rs/src/probe/stlink/mod.rs:886:12 | 886 | Ok(value) | ^^^^^ not found in this scope error: aborting due to previous error For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0425`. Original diagnostics will follow. warning: useless conversion to the same type: `probe::stlink::StlinkError` --> probe-rs/src/probe/stlink/usb_interface.rs:235:24 | 235 | return Err(StlinkError::NotEnoughBytesWritten { | ________________________^ 236 | | is: written_bytes, 237 | | should: CMD_LEN, 238 | | } 239 | | .into()); | |___________________^ | = help: for further information visit https://rust-lang.github.io/rust-clippy/master/index.html#useless_conversion = note: `#[warn(clippy::useless_conversion)]` on by default help: consider removing `.into()` | 235 ~ return Err(StlinkError::NotEnoughBytesWritten { 236 + is: written_bytes, 237 + should: CMD_LEN, 238 ~ }); | warning: useless conversion to the same type: `probe::stlink::StlinkError` --> probe-rs/src/probe/stlink/mod.rs:300:25 | 300 | Err(StlinkError::VoltageDivisionByZero.into()) | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ help: consider removing `.into()`: `StlinkError::VoltageDivisionByZero` | = help: for further information visit https://rust-lang.github.io/rust-clippy/master/index.html#useless_conversion warning: this let-binding has unit value --> probe-rs/src/probe/stlink/mod.rs:863:9 | 863 | / let value = retry_on_wait(|| { 864 | | self.device.write( 865 | | &[ 866 | | commands::JTAG_COMMAND, ... | 881 | | self.get_last_rw_status() 882 | | })?; | |____________^ | = help: for further information visit https://rust-lang.github.io/rust-clippy/master/index.html#let_unit_value = note: `#[warn(clippy::let_unit_value)]` on by default help: omit the `let` binding | 863 ~ retry_on_wait(|| { 864 + self.device.write( 865 + &[ 866 + commands::JTAG_COMMAND, 867 + commands::JTAG_READMEM_32BIT, 868 + addbytes[0], 869 + addbytes[1], 870 + addbytes[2], 871 + addbytes[3], 872 + data_length[0], 873 + data_length[1], 874 + apsel, 875 + ], 876 + &[], 877 + data, 878 + TIMEOUT, 879 + )?; 880 + 881 + self.get_last_rw_status() 882 + })?; | warning: useless conversion to the same type: `probe::stlink::StlinkError` --> probe-rs/src/probe/stlink/mod.rs:1841:14 | 1841 | &StlinkError::BanksNotAllowedOnDPRegister.into() | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ help: consider removing `.into()`: `StlinkError::BanksNotAllowedOnDPRegister` | = help: for further information visit https://rust-lang.github.io/rust-clippy/master/index.html#useless_conversion warning: useless conversion to the same type: `probe::stlink::StlinkError` --> probe-rs/src/probe/stlink/mod.rs:1844:14 | 1844 | &StlinkError::CommandFailed(Status::JtagFreqNotSupported).into() | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ help: consider removing `.into()`: `StlinkError::CommandFailed(Status::JtagFreqNotSupported)` | = help: for further information visit https://rust-lang.github.io/rust-clippy/master/index.html#useless_conversion warning: useless conversion to the same type: `probe::stlink::StlinkError` --> probe-rs/src/probe/stlink/mod.rs:1847:14 | 1847 | &StlinkError::CommandFailed(Status::SwdDpWait).into() | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ help: consider removing `.into()`: `StlinkError::CommandFailed(Status::SwdDpWait)` | = help: for further information visit https://rust-lang.github.io/rust-clippy/master/index.html#useless_conversion warning: useless conversion to the same type: `probe::stlink::StlinkError` --> probe-rs/src/probe/stlink/mod.rs:1850:14 | 1850 | &StlinkError::CommandFailed(Status::SwdApWait).into() | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ help: consider removing `.into()`: `StlinkError::CommandFailed(Status::SwdApWait)` | = help: for further information visit https://rust-lang.github.io/rust-clippy/master/index.html#useless_conversion warning: `probe-rs` (lib test) generated 7 warnings (3 duplicates) warning: `probe-rs` (lib) generated 3 warnings Checking probe-rs-cli-util v0.16.0 (/Users/tiwalun/code/probe-rs/probe-rs-cli-util) Checking gdb-server v0.16.0 (/Users/tiwalun/code/probe-rs/gdb-server) Checking target-gen v0.16.0 (/Users/tiwalun/code/probe-rs/target-gen) Checking rtthost v0.16.0 (/Users/tiwalun/code/probe-rs/rtthost) Checking smoke_tester v0.16.0 (/Users/tiwalun/code/probe-rs/smoke-tester) Checking probe-rs-debugger v0.16.0 (/Users/tiwalun/code/probe-rs/debugger) warning: failed to automatically apply fixes suggested by rustc to crate `probe_rs` after fixes were automatically applied the compiler reported errors within these files: * probe-rs/src/probe/stlink/mod.rs This likely indicates a bug in either rustc or cargo itself, and we would appreciate a bug report! You're likely to see a number of compiler warnings after this message which cargo attempted to fix but failed. If you could open an issue at https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues quoting the full output of this command we'd be very appreciative! Note that you may be able to make some more progress in the near-term fixing code with the `--broken-code` flag The following errors were reported: error[E0425]: cannot find value `value` in this scope --> probe-rs/src/probe/stlink/mod.rs:886:12 | 886 | Ok(value) | ^^^^^ not found in this scope error: aborting due to previous error For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0425`. Original diagnostics will follow. warning: `probe-rs` (lib) generated 3 warnings (3 duplicates) Compiling cargo-flash v0.16.0 (/Users/tiwalun/code/probe-rs/cargo-flash) Compiling cargo-embed v0.16.0 (/Users/tiwalun/code/probe-rs/cargo-embed) Compiling probe-rs-cli v0.16.0 (/Users/tiwalun/code/probe-rs/cli) Finished dev [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 1m 02s ```

The error occured while trying to compile this commit: https://github.com/probe-rs/probe-rs/commit/3a192909b544c03e1eb3b5da8ea0476f9d75de9d ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.67.0 (fc594f156 2023-01-24) binary: rustc commit-hash: fc594f15669680fa70d255faec3ca3fb507c3405 commit-date: 2023-01-24 host: aarch64-apple-darwin release: 1.67.0 LLVM version: 15.0.6 ``` The error also occurs with the following nightly version: ``` rustc 1.69.0-nightly (e972bc808 2023-01-29) binary: rustc commit-hash: e972bc8083d5228536dfd42913c8778b6bb04c8e commit-date: 2023-01-29 host: aarch64-apple-darwin release: 1.69.0-nightly LLVM version: 15.0.7 ```
